title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17ยง 2.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17ยง 2.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

The following words and phrases, as used in this Part, are
defined as follows: (a) Department
means the New York State Department of Transportation. (b) Committee means the Committee on Open

Government. (c) Data subject means
any natural person with respect to whom personal information has been collected
by the department. (d) Personal
information means any information concerning a data subject which, because of
name, number, symbol, mark or other identifier, can be used to identify the
data subject. (e) Disclose means to
reveal, release, transfer, disseminate or otherwise communicate personal
information or records orally, in writing or by electronic or any other means
to other than the data subject. (f) Record means any item, collection or grouping of personal information about a
data subject which is maintained and is retrievable by use of the name or other
identifier of the data subject. The term record shall not include personal
information which is not used to make any determination about the data subject
if it is: (1)
a telephone book or directory
which is used exclusively for telephone and directory information; (2)
a card catalog, book or other resource
material in any library; (3)
any
compilation of information containing names and addresses only which is used
exclusively for mailing department information; (4)
personal information required by law to
be maintained, or required by law to be used, only for statistical research or
reporting purposes; (5)
information
requested by the department which is necessary for the agency to answer
unsolicited requests by the data subject for information; or
(6)
correspondence files. (g) Routine use means, with
respect to the disclosure of a record or personal information, any use of such
record or personal information relevant to the purposes for which it was
collected, and which use is necessary to the statutory duties of department or
is necessary to the department for its operation of a program specifically
authorized by law. (h) System of
records means any group of records under the actual or constructive control of
the department pertaining to one or more data subjects for which personal
information is retrievable by use of a name or other identifier of a data
subject. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
